Deleting Items in View Comparisons

The View Comparison utility permits you to delete child folders or items that exist in only one of the folders you have selected. Items that exist in both of the folders cannot be removed.

To delete child folders or items that exist in only one folder:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Select one or more folders, files, change requests, or requirements from the item pane.

    4. If you are working with tasks or topics, you can select only one item at a time. Because tasks and topics appear in tree form, deleting a task or topic deletes its children as well.

  4. Do one of the following:

    • From the Item or context menu, select Delete Items.

    • Click the Delete Items button on the toolbar.

    The system displays the following message: Delete selected items that do not exist in both views?

  5. Click OK. A progress bar indicates the degree of  completion.
